key_channel_insights.line_content: OTAs still match FI.com on 88 % of itineraries, but parity has fallen 6 ppt WoW as ‘offer-not-found’ cases doubled to 12.5 %, exposing growing distribution gaps without price inflation risk.

Metasearch undercuts the website on 88 % of itineraries and shows 12 % missing offers; although the average discount is small (-0.10 %), the sheer coverage makes this the highest revenue-leak channel.
GDS retains 87.5 % parity and negligible undercutting (0.7 %), but missing fares climbed to 11.8 %, signalling an urgent content-sync concern, especially on short-haul and IS-origin segments.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: OTAs match the website on 88 % of itineraries; parity slipped 6 ppt WoW and 8 ppt MoM.
12.5 % of website fares are absent on OTAs—double last month—signalling widening content gaps.
0 % of checks show OTA prices above the website; under-pricing is negligible, keeping margin risk low.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Share rose to 12.5 % (+6 ppt WoW, +10 ppt MoM), the fastest-worsening metric.
Still dominant at 87.5 % but eroding in step with availability gaps.
No occurrences this week; last seen at 2.7 % a month ago.
Zero instances across all periods—OTAs are not inflating prices.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: 14.6 % OTA N/A (+7.8 ppt WoW) cuts parity to 85 %.
Maintains 92 % parity; missing offers 8.2 % (+2 ppt WoW).

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: IS origins show 18.1 % missing offers (+8.4 ppt WoW), dropping parity to 82 %.
Non-IS origins hold 97 % parity with only 3.4 % missing fares.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Same-week travel has 15 % missing fares (+6.2 ppt WoW), parity down to 85 %.
>3-week window retains 96 % parity with 4.4 % missing offers.

mse_highlights.line_content: MSE priced below the website on 88 % of itineraries; no higher-priced or parity cases registered.
11.8 % of website fares missing on MSE, up 5 ppt WoW and 10 ppt MoM.
Non-IS origins show 98 % undercutting and the largest average discount (-0.14 %).

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Coverage slipped to 11.8 %, more than doubling MoM; concentrated in IS and close-in markets.
Still high at 88.2 % but down 5.3 ppt WoW; average discount stable at ‑0.10 %.
0 % of OD pairs matched the website across all comparison periods.
No instances of MSE prices above the website, eliminating margin upside risk.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: 85.6 % undercutting (-7.8 ppt WoW); missing offers peak at 14.4 %.
91.8 % undercutting (-2.0 ppt WoW) with low 8.2 % offer gaps.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 18.1 % not-found; 81.9 % cheaper (-8.5 ppt WoW); discount depth ‑0.08 %.
98.3 % cheaper with ‑0.14 % discount; only 1.7 % offers missing.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 85 % cheaper (-6.3 ppt WoW); 15 % offers missing, main driver of gap.
95.6 % cheaper (-2.4 ppt WoW); 4.4 % offers missing, smallest discount (-0.09 %).

gds_highlights.line_content: 87.5 % of GDS itineraries priced exactly as website; none higher-priced.
Missing fares up to 11.8 % (+5.3 ppt WoW, +9.8 ppt MoM).
Only 0.7 % cheaper in GDS, with a negligible ‑0.06 % average discount.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Website fares not found rose from 6.5 % to 11.8 % WoW; urgent fare-loading fix needed.
Parity still high at 87.5 % but fell 6 ppt WoW, 9.8 ppt MoM.
GDS-lower cases up to 0.66 %, average discount just ‑0.06 %.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: 14.6 % missing fares cut parity to 84.5 %, 7 ppt worse than long-haul.
91.8 % parity with 8.2 % missing fares; no price deltas.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 18.1 % fares absent; parity 80.9 %, weakest across segments.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 15 % missing fares; parity down to 84.1 % for last-minute sales.
93.3 % parity; 4.4 % missing fares and zero undercutting.
